02140     int* ghost_rules_allocated, 
02142     int* ghost_rules_size, 
02146     int** ghost_type, 
02148     int** bridge_type, 
02150     int** num_layers, 
02152     int* err  
02154 );
02155   /* end group imeshp_ghost */
02157   /* end group imeshp_comm */
02159 
02164 /***************************************************************************/
02179 void iMeshP_loadAll(
02180     iMesh_Instance instance, 
02182     const iMeshP_PartitionHandle partition, 
02184     const iBase_EntitySetHandle entity_set, 
02186     const char* name, 
02188     const char* options, 
02190     int* err, 
02192     int name_len, 
02194     int options_len  
02196 );
02197 
02198 /***************************************************************************/
02202 void iMeshP_saveAll(
02203     iMesh_Instance instance, 
02205     const iMeshP_PartitionHandle partition, 
02207     const iBase_EntitySetHandle entity_set, 
02209     const char* name, 
02211     const char* options, 
02213     int* err, 
02215     const int name_len, 
02217     int options_len  
02219 );
02220   /* end group imeshp_file */
02222 
02223 /*
02224 ------------------------------------------------
02225 Major Items left to do:
02226 -  Support for multiple partitions.
02227    We discussed designating a given partition as 
02228    the "active" partition; i.e., the partition that is actually used in 
02229    the distribution of mesh data in distributed memory.  We were concerned 
02230    that when multiple partitions were used, multiple copies of mesh 
02231    entities would be needed to fully support multiple partitions at the 
02232    same time.  Designating one partition as "active" would store data 
02233    with respect to only one partition.
02234 
02235 -  File I/O support.
02236    Need common set of options to allow interoperability.
02237    Support single files, N << P files on P processes, and P files.
02238    Support reading and writing partition information.
02239    Support initial parallel partitioning of serial file data.
02240    Support storing mapping of parts to processes in files.
02241 
02242 ------------------------------------------------
02243 Minor Items left to do:
02244 -  Determine which capabilities need both "getNumX" and "getX" functions.
02245    That is, when would an application need "getNumX" to allocate memory
02246    for "getX" or separately from "getX".  When could we use only "getX"
02247    and return numX as a byproduct.
02248 
02249 -  Determine with functions need "Ent" and "EntArr" versions, or whether
02250    we should adopt only the more general "EntArr" version.
02251 
02252 -  Determine whether to revise iMeshP_createPartition to make it less MPI 
02253    specific.  We don't want to require applications to link with MPI if the 
02254    implementation doesn't require it.  We may define an ITAPS_Comm name 
02255    typedef'ed appropriately.
02256 
02257 -  iMeshP_getOwnerCopy could be achieved by calling iMeshP_getOwnerPart
02258    followed by iMeshP_getCopyOnPart.  Do we want to keep iMeshP_getOwnerCopy?
02259 
02260 -  We could enhance the functions to update tag data from shared 
02261    entities in owner to perform mathematical operations (similar to MPI_SUM).
02262    From Carl:  "getTag*Operate: Again, we haven't got this in serial.  Does 
02263    the existence of such operations imply that we expect to implement 
02264    fields as tags? (Because that wasn't what I was assuming about field 
02265    implementations at all, personally...)  Note that I'm not opposed to 
02266    this sort of global reduction operation, I just wonder whether it'll see 
02267    use outside of field-like situations.  If not, then it should be in 
02268    parallel fields, not parallel mesh, and usage for 
02269    fields-implemented-as-tags should be handled there."
02270 
02271 ------------------------------------------------
02272 Comments and resolved questions:  
02273 
02274 - For now, we will not include an iterator over local (to a
02275   process) parts within a partition.  If it is needed, it can be added
02276   later.
02277 
02278 - Currently, iMesh doesn't have the functionality to get entities or 
02279   entity sets by type and tag in serial.  Should it?  
02280   Many people said it would be useful; others said it could be costly
02281   (in parallel) or numerically difficult (for floating point values).
02282   This issue is an iMesh issue, not a parallel interface issue, so
02283   for this document, the issue is resolved.  The resolution:  If 
02284   iMesh adopts this capability, we will add it to the
02285   parallel interface.
02286 
02287 - We will not include functions that return all entities with 
02288   given characteristics within a partition; the memory use of these
02289   functions can be large.  Instead, we will return entity information
02290   with respect to parts and/or mesh instances.  If the user wants such
02291   info, he should go through the mechanics of gathering it himself so
02292   that he is painfully aware of how much memory he is allocating.
02293   Removed the following global queries:
02294   + All tag names over the partition;
02295   + All entities in this partition having a given type, tag and/or 
02296     tag name.
02297   + All entity sets in this partition having a given
02298     type, tag and/or tag name.
02299 
02300 - We will not include functions that return information about each
02301   part and/or process in a partition.  Such functions limit memory 
02302   scalability for large numbers of parts.  If the user wants such
02303   info, he should go through the mechanics of gathering it himself so
02304   that he is painfully aware of how much memory he is allocating.
02305   Removed the following global queries:
02306   + The number of entities in each part of the partition;
02307   + The number of entity sets in each part of the partition;
02308   + The number of entities with given type, tag, and/or
02309     tag name in each part of the partition;
02310   + The number of entity sets with given type, tag, 
02311     and/or tag name in each part of the partition;
02312   + All tag names in each part of the partition;
02313 
02314 - Part assignments computed with respect to a set of 
02315   entities induce part assignments to adjacent entities in an
02316   implementation-dependent fashion.  That is, if a partition is computed
02317   with respect to regions, queries about ownership of faces and vertices
02318   are valid.
02319 
02320 ------------------------------------------------
02321 Discussed but unresolved questions:
02322 
02323 - We discussed adding functions that give
02324   hints to an implementation about which data mappings the application 
02325   will use, allowing the implementation to pre-compute them if it chooses 
02326   to.  The example discussed was mapping between entities and parts, but 
02327   other examples in iMesh may also exist.
02328 
02329 - We discussed storing in a partition 
02330   information about which "objects" were used in computing the partition.  
02331   These objects can be single entities or groups of entities.
02332   KDD:  Perhaps this capability should be part of the load-balancing service.
02333 
02334 */
02335 
02336 /*--------------------------------*/
02337 /* NOTES FROM BOOTCAMP MARCH 2008 */
02338 /*--------------------------------*/
02339 /*
02340 -  Changed getPartRank to getRankOfPart.  (Carl)
02341 -  Made sure iMeshP_getNumOfTypeAll and iMeshP_getNumOfTopoAll were
02342    documented as collective operations.  (Carl)
02343 -  Changed suffix "Par" to "All".  (Lori)
02344 -  Added iMeshP_testPart() to test status of part handle, returning
02345    LOCAL, REMOTE, or INVALID.  (Mark M, Lori).
02346    6/25/08:  Removed this function since part handles can no longer be remote.
02347    If an application wants to test the validity of a part handle, it can try
02348    to compute its Part ID.
02349 -  Changed iMeshP_addCopyOf and iMeshP_rmvCopyOf back to
02350    iMeshP_addGhostOf and iMeshP_rmvGhostOf.  If we wanted to use these
02351    functions for adding boundary copies, we'd have to include a list of
02352    already existing remote copies in the arguments, as well as
02353    communicate with parts already owning copies to let them know a ghost
02354    copy has been made.  Actually, this raises an interesting question:
02355    does a boundary copy need to know about all ghost copies of it?
02356 -  Change getEntParStatus to getEntStatus.  (Lori)
02357 -  Changed sendEntArrToPartsPar to exchEntArrToPartsAll.  (Lori,Tim)
02358 
02359 
02360 Parts and Processes:
02361 -  Martin argued for consecutive unique Part IDs in addition to or
02362    instead of Part handles.  He will send use cases.   If we decide to
02363    add them back to the interface, we could compute them in
02364    iMeshP_syncPartitionAll rather than in iMeshP_createPart.  That is, an
02365    application couldn't access them until after iMeshP_syncPartitionAll.
02366    6/25/08:  On follow-up, Martin couldn't recall why having consecutive
02367    PartIDs was necessary.  While we all agree they are conceptually nice,
02368    they are difficult to implement and not really necessary.  Part IDs will
02369    be globally unique but not necessarily consecutive.
02370 -  Are part handles globally unique?  They probably need to be
02371    globally unique in order for them to be useful as remote part
02372    handles.  Also, does the process rank need to be encoded in the part
02373    handle in order to map from parts to processes for communication?
02374    6/25/08:  DECIDED:  We will have globally unique part IDs.  Part handles
02375    will be valid for only local parts.  Accessing remote parts must be done
02376    via Part IDs.
02377 -  If in iMeshP_syncPartitionAll, we computed a mapping from part
02378    handles to integers 0,..., k-1, we could store only ranges of
02379    integers to achieve the part-to-process and process-to-parts mappings;
02380    this would require O(P) storage per process for P processes.
02381    6/5/08:  DECIDED:  Do not need getPartOnRank or getNumPartOnRank.  These
02382    functions were troublesome due to their storage or communication 
02383    requirements.  We decided to remove them.
02384 -  Alternatively, the mapping of all parts to processes can be stored
02385    in O(k) total memory, distributed across processors (e.g., a
02386    distributed data directory) but interrogating the directory requires
02387    communication.  
02388    6/5/08:  See note above.
02389 -  iMeshP_getPartsOnRank created discussion and needs to be resolved.
02390    IMeshP_getPartsOnRank would likely require either O(k) storage per
02391    process for k parts or communication.  For other points, please see
02392    Mark M's 3/12/08 email.  
02393    6/5/08:  See note above.
02394 
02395 CreateEnt:
02396 -  Carl asked if we should have a version of createEnt that accepts a
02397    part handle.  Should this function be used only for creating owned
02398    entities?   How do you envision creating part boundary entities when a
02399    parallel mesh is initially loaded?  
02400 
02401 Ghost entities:
02402 -  We currently have a mechanism only for pushing ghosts onto other
02403    parts.  Will we want a mechanism for pulling them, too?  (E.g., a
02404    part says, "I want ghosts for this entity.")
02405 
02406 PartNbor functions:
02407 -  Did we agree to remove the entity type from these functions?  That
02408    is, do we want to return the part IDs for all parts that have
02409    any copies?  The entity type was intended to allow us to get the part
02410    IDs for all parts that have copies of a given type (perhaps
02411    ALL_TYPES).  
02412 
02413 Functions handling both Parts and Entity Sets:
02414 -  Tim said these function names (e.g., iMeshP_getNumOfType,
02415    iMeshP_getAllVtxCoord) are too close to existing iMesh function
02416    names, even though the argument lists would be different.  He agreed
02417    to email suggestions for better names.
02418 
02419 Copies:
02420 -  Functions getNumCopies, getCopies, getCopyParts, and getCopyOnPart
02421    have different behavior for ghost and part-boundary copies.  Ghosts
02422    will return only itself and its owner in getCopies; part-boundary
02423    entities will return copies on other parts as well.
02424 -  Tim envisions applications (e.g., FETI methods) updating tag data
02425    in their copies that they would like to accumulate back to the
02426    owner.  Xiaolin said that he writes in his ghosts, but doesn't send
02427    those values back to the owner.  Currently, we have the ability 
02428    to send tag data only from owners to ghosts.  Tim will look at this issue
02429    and propose a solution.
02430 
02431 Communication:
02432 -  Although we should think in terms of parts, communication really
02433    occurs with respect to processes.  We need to make sure all our
02434    communication routines make sense with respect to both processes and
02435    parts, and perhaps, revise their descriptions.  Also, if we send to
02436    parts, the implementation really does need the mapping of parts to
02437    processes. 
02438 
02439 Entity Owner/Status Queries:
02440 -  Should we combine functions getEntOwnerPart and getEntStatus into
02441    one function?  Or should we combine functions getOwnerCopy and
02442    getEntOwner into one function?  Or should we remove getOwnerCopy and
02443    make applications call getOwnerPart followed by getCopyOnPart?
02444 
02445 Reducing storage:
02446 -  Mark Miller proposed allowing the user to specify the amount of 
02447    copying done by the implementation, depending on applications' needs.
02448    For example, for a static viz application, every boundary entity may not
02449    need to know where all its copies are, so the implementation would not
02450    have to store them.  Can the implementations accept a flag advising them how
02451    much copying is needed?  If so, the implementations could choose to 
02452    optimize storage or ignore the flag.
02453 */
02454
